interface.name: zaura_shell
interface.description: The global interface exposing aura shell capabilities is used to instantiate an interface extension for a wl_surface object. This extended interface will then allow the client to use aura shell specific functionality.

entry.name: aura_surface_exists
entry.summary: the surface already has an aura surface object associated

entry.name: aura_output_exists
entry.summary: the output already has an aura output object associated

request.name: get_aura_surface

description.summary: extend surface interface for aura shell

request.description: Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_surface to provide aura shell functionality. If the given wl_surface is not associated with a shell surface, the shell_surface_missing protocol error is raised.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: the new aura surface interface id

request.name: get_aura_output

description.summary: extend output interface for aura shell

request.description: Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_output to provide aura shell functionality.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: the new aura output interface id

enum.name: layout_mode
enum.description: Specifies the server's window layout mode.

event.name: layout_mode
event.description: Sends the layout_mode used by the server.

event.name: bug_fix
event.description: Sends a monorail ID of a bug fixed on the exo server that clients can use to gate functionality.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: ID of a single bug fix

event.name: desks_changed
event.description: Notifies when there is a change in global desks state. This is emitted on desk name changes, desk addition/removal or desks are reordered. "desk_names" argument contains the set of null terminated strings as names of desks.

arg.name: desk_names
arg.summary: an array of existing desks' names

event.name: desk_activation_changed

description.summary: sends the index of the active desk

event.description: Notifies when there is a change of the active desk.

event.name: activated
event.description: Notifies client that the activated surface changed.

request.name: surface_submission_in_pixel_coordinates

description.summary: surfaces will be submitted in pixel coordinates

request.description: [Deprecated] Informs the server that when submitting surfaces, this client will not use wl_surface_set_buffer_scale to report the scales, nor will it apply scale via vp_viewporter. Instead the server should apply an appropriate scale transform to have the submitted buffers composited correctly.

request.name: get_aura_toplevel_for_xdg_toplevel
request.description: Retrieve the aura toplevel interface for a given xdg toplevel interface

arg.name: id
arg.summary: the new aura toplevel interface id

request.name: get_aura_popup_for_xdg_popup
request.description: Retrieve the aura popup interface for the given xdg popup interface

request.name: release
request.description:
Using this request a client can tell the server that it is not going to use the zaura_shell object anymore. This does not affect any other objects.
This is named "release" because "destroy" is a special named function used for freeing wl_proxy objects. Naming it "destroy" will cause marshalling errors when running on lower versioned hosts. All "release" requests here should be renamed to "destroy" if we move to aura-shell v2.

event.name: set_overview_mode
event.description: Notifies client that the server has entered overview mode. Overview mode displays all app windows associated with the current desk for the user.

event.name: unset_overview_mode
event.description: Notifies client that the server has exited overview mode.

event.name: compositor_version
event.description: Sends the Exo compositor version information.

event.name: all_bug_fixes_sent

description.summary: completed sending all bug fix ids

event.description: Notifies client that all the IDs of a bug fixed on the exo server is sent. Bug fix ids are sent via `bug_fix` events which sends ids one by one, not an array. This event is used to confirm all ids are sent.

event.name: window_corners_radii

description.summary: sends the radius of each corner the window

event.description: Sends the radius of each corner of the window to the clients in dips.

interface.name: zaura_surface

description.summary: aura shell interface to a wl_surface

interface.description: An additional interface to a wl_surface object, which allows the client to access aura shell specific functionality for surface.

enum.name: frame_type
enum.description: Frame types that can be used to decorate a surface.

request.name: set_frame
request.description: [Deprecated] Suggests a surface should use a specific frame. Deprecated since M105. See the set_decoration method on zaura_toplevel and zaura_popup.

request.name: set_parent

description.summary: set the parent of this surface

request.description: Set the "parent" of this surface. "x" and "y" arguments specify the initial position for surface relative to parent.

request.name: set_frame_colors

description.summary: set the frame colors of this surface

request.description: Set the frame colors. This must be set before the initial commit first, otherwise the subsequent request may not be fulfilled.

arg.name: active_color
arg.summary: 32 bit ARGB color value, not premultiplied

arg.name: inactive_color
arg.summary: 32 bit ARGB color value, not premultiplied

request.name: set_startup_id

description.summary: set the startup ID of this surface

request.description: Set the startup ID.

request.name: set_application_id

description.summary: set the application ID of this surface

request.description: Set the application ID.

request.name: set_client_surface_id

description.summary: set the client surface ID of this surface

request.description: Deprecated. Please use set_client_surface_str_id instead. Set the identifier of the surface assigned by the client.

enum.name: occlusion_change_reason
enum.description: Enum describing why an occlusion change happened. An occlusion change as a result of a user action could include things like the user moving a window, changing occlusion, or opening/closing a window, changing the occlusion.

entry.name: user_action
entry.summary: occlusion changed as a result of a user action

request.name: set_occlusion_tracking
request.description: Sets occlusion tracking on this surface. The client will be updated with a new occlusion fraction when the amount of occlusion of this surface changes.

request.name: unset_occlusion_tracking
request.description: Unsets occlusion tracking for this surface.

event.name: occlusion_changed
event.description: Notifies when there is a change in the amount this surface is occluded. The occlusion update is sent as a fixed point number from 0 to 1, representing the proportion of occlusion.

request.name: activate

description.summary: Indicate that this window wants to be the active window

request.description: [Deprecated] Make this the active window. This usually implies something like restacking this surface to the foreground. The compositor is free to ignore this request if it deems the client to be misbehaving. Typically this request will only be honoured in response to some user driven event, such as executing an application or opening a file in a window that already exists.

request.name: draw_attention

description.summary: Indicate that this window wants some of the user's attention

request.description: Draw attention to this surface in a way that does not change the user's focus. This usually means animating window decorations or taskbar icons. The compositor can still ignore this request if it deems fit, but unlike draw_focus, these requests are expected to come from background tasks, and are more likely to be honoured.

enum.name: fullscreen_mode

description.summary: Specifies the behavior of the surface in fullscreen.

enum.description: [Deprecated] Possible windowing system behaviors if this surface were to go fullscreen.

entry.name: immersive
entry.summary: user can access system UIs such as the shelf and window frame by pointing to, or swiping over, the screen edge

entry.name: plain
entry.summary: user cannot access system UIs using mouse/touches

request.name: set_fullscreen_mode

description.summary: Sets the behavior of the surface in fullscreen.

request.description:
[Deprecated] Use the set_fullscreen_mode in the toplevel interface. Suggests how the windowing system should behave if this surface were to go fullscreen. Does not make the surface fullscreen.
Typically the default mode is "immersive".

request.name: set_client_surface_str_id

description.summary: set the client surface ID of this surface

request.description: Set the identifier of the surface assigned by the client.

request.name: set_server_start_resize

description.summary: request a server-side shadow for surface

request.description: Suggests a surface to have client-side decoration, but server-side decides when and where to start the resize. The server may also apply visual effects to indicate that the resize operation is ongoing.

request.name: intent_to_snap

description.summary: client intents to snap the surface.

request.description: [Deprecated] Use intent_to_snap on zaura_toplevel. Notify (or inform) the server the client's intent to snap the window. To inform it's no longer willing to snap, send 'none'.

request.name: set_snap_left

description.summary: snap the surface to the left.

request.description: [Deprecated] Use set_snap_primary on zaura_toplevel. Request that surface is snapped to the left.

request.name: set_snap_right

description.summary: snap the surface to the right.

request.description: [Deprecated] Use set_snap_secondary on zaura_toplevel. Request that surface is snapped to the right.

request.name: unset_snap
request.description: [Deprecated] Use unset_snap on zaura_toplevel. Request that surface resets snapping.

event.name: lock_frame_normal

description.summary: Notify the client that server intent to lock window in normal or restore state

event.description: Notifies the client to lock window in normal or restore state. When window is locked, the window frame should look like it is in restored state, but actually isn't. Locking happends while dragging a maximized window.

event.name: unlock_frame_normal

description.summary: Notify the client that server intent to unlock window's normal or restore state

event.description: Notifies the client to unlock window if it is previously locked. Unlocking happends while dragging a maximized window.

request.name: set_window_session_id
request.description: Set window session id to the surface.

request.name: set_can_go_back
request.description: Sets that the surface can go back as per its navigation list. This allows the server to react to by minimizing the window upon a system wide back gesture.

request.name: unset_can_go_back
request.description: Unsets that the surface can go back as per its navigation list. See above.

request.name: set_pip
request.description: Requests that the surface is set to Picture-in-Picture (PIP).

request.name: unset_pip
request.description: Requests that the surface is unset from Picture-in-Picture (PIP).

request.name: set_aspect_ratio

description.summary: Set aspect ratio for the surface.

request.description: Sets the aspect ratio of the surface.

enum.name: occlusion_state
enum.description: Describes the occlusion state of a surface.

entry.name: unknown
entry.summary: The surface's occlusion state isn't tracked

event.name: occlusion_state_changed

description.summary: Notify the client that the occlusion state changed

event.description: Notifies the client that the occlusion state of a window has changed. Clients will only receive these messages if they previously request occlusion tracking via set_occlusion_tracking for a particular surface.

request.name: move_to_desk
request.description: If |index| equals -1, requests that the server toggles whether client is visible on all workspaces. If |index| is not -1, requests that the server moves the client to the desk at |index|.

event.name: desk_changed
event.description: Notifies when there is a change in the desk state of a window. This is emitted when a window is moved to another desk or when its assigned-to-all-desks state changes.

arg.name: state
arg.summary: index of desk or -1 for a window assigned to all desks

request.name: set_initial_workspace
request.description: If |initial_workspace| equals '-1', a window is restored and visible on all workspaces, Otherwise, set the initial workspace to restore the window to the corresponding workspace. This is not double buffered and must be set before attaching a buffer.

arg.name: initial_workspace
arg.summary: intial workspace for restoring or '-1' for visible on all workspaces

request.name: set_pin
request.description:
Requests that a window is pinned which means that the system does not allow the user to leave the window until an exit criteria is met.
This is a request to get the window pinned so that the user cannot get to any other window / application. There are two modes: A. trusted is 0 - which is slightly less restrictive and allows the user to get out of the window by a predefined way of authentication. B. trusted is not 0 in which case a trusted application was locking down the system and needs to unlock. This is used for e.g. School tests.

request.name: unset_pin
request.description:
Requests that the user can leave a previously pinned window.
This is a request to unpin a previously pinned window. It does not matter if the window was locked with the trusted state or not.

event.name: start_throttle
event.description: Informs the client to start throttling on the surface.

event.name: end_throttle
event.description: Informs the client to end throttling on the surface.

request.name: release
request.description:
Destroy the zaura_surface object. A client should destroy this object when the role is unmapped from a wl_surface.
See zaura_shell.release for destructor naming.

request.name: show_tooltip
request.description: Show tooltip on server side. `x` and `y` specifies the location of tooltip in surface local coordinates. `hide_delay` and `show_delay` specify the time to wait until showing/hiding tooltip. The unit is millisecond.

arg.name: show_delay
arg.summary: delay to show tooltip in millisecond

arg.name: hide_delay
arg.summary: delay to hide tooltip in millisecond

request.name: hide_tooltip
request.description: Hide tooltip created by the same client on server side. This may be called even when there is no tooltip window to hide.

event.name: tooltip_shown

description.summary: tooltip is shown by server side

event.description: Informs the client that the tooltip is shown with states. `x` and `y` specifies the location of tooltip in surface local coordinates.

event.name: tooltip_hidden

description.summary: tooltip is hidden by server side

event.description: Informs the client that the tooltip is hidden.

request.name: set_accessibility_id

description.summary: set accessibility ID to the surface

request.description: Set accessibility window ID to the surface. A negative number removes the existing accessibility ID from the surface.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: Accessibility ID. Negative number removes existing accessibility ID from the surface.

interface.name: zaura_output

description.summary: aura shell interface to a wl_output

interface.description: An additional interface to a wl_output object, which allows the client to access aura shell specific functionality for output.

enum.name: scale_property
enum.description: These flags describe properties of an output scale. They are used in the flags bitfield of the scale event.

entry.name: current
entry.summary: indicates this is the current scale

entry.name: preferred
entry.summary: indicates this is the preferred scale

event.name: scale

description.summary: advertise available scales for the output

event.description:
The scale event describes an available scale for the output.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and there will always be one scale, the current scale. The event is sent again if an output changes scale, for the scale that is now current. In other words, the current scale is always the last scale that was received with the current flag set.

event.name: connection
event.description:
The connection event describes how the output is connected.
The event is sent when binding to the output object.

event.name: device_scale_factor

description.summary: advertise device scale factor for the output

event.description:
This event describes the device specific scale factor for the output.
The device specific scale factor is not expected the change during the lifetime of the output. And it is not limited to an integer value like the scale factor provided by wl_output interface. The exact contents scale used by the compositor can be determined by combining this device scale factor with the current output scale.
The event is sent when binding to the output object.

event.name: insets

description.summary: advertise the work area insets for the output

event.description:
This event describes the insets for the output in logical screen coordinates, from which the work area can be calculated.
This event is sent before wl_output.done, after which the client would apply the change.

event.name: logical_transform
event.description:
This event describes the logical transform for the output. Whereas wl_output.geometry's transform corresponds to the display's panel rotation, the logical transform corresponds to the display's logical rotation.
This event is sent before wl_output.done, after which the client would apply the change.

request.name: release
request.description:
Destroy this zaura_shell object.
Destroying a bound zaura_shell object while there are zaura_surfaces still alive created by this zaura_shell object instance is illegal and will result in a protocol error.
See zaura_shell.release for destructor naming.

event.name: display_id
event.description: This event describes the 64bit display id assigned to each display by ChromeOS. The value is opaque and should not be interpreted.

event.name: activated
event.description: Notifies that this output is now active output. It is typically used as a target when a new window is created without specific bounds.

interface.name: zaura_toplevel

description.summary: aura shell interface to the toplevel shell

interface.description: An interface to the toplevel shell, which allows the client to access shell specific functionality.

enum.name: orientation_lock
enum.description: Defines orientation request when a surface is in fullscreen.

request.name: set_orientation_lock

description.summary: set orientation lock for a remote surface

request.description: Request a specific orientation behavior when this surface is in fullscreen.

request.name: surface_submission_in_pixel_coordinates

description.summary: surface will be submitted in pixel coordinates

request.description: Informs the server that when submitting this surface, this client will not use wl_surface_set_buffer_scale to report the scales, nor will it apply scale via vp_viewporter. Instead the server should apply an appropriate scale transform for the submitted buffers to be composited correctly.

request.name: set_supports_screen_coordinates

description.summary: enables screen coordinates in window bounds

request.description: Requesting this will enable screen coordinates in surfaces associated with aura_toplevel including sub surfaces and popup windows who added this toplevel as a parent. This should be set before first commit.

request.name: set_window_bounds
request.description: Request a new location and bounds of the surface in DP screen coordinates. The size will be applied to visible bounds used in set_geometry. The output is a hint for the compositor to determine which output the window should move to. If the output is null, the compositor should make decision solely by the given bounds. These parameters are just a request and the compositor may ignore, adjust the size and position based on the rule imposed by the window manager, or may preserve it for future operations. For example, the compositor will not allow a position outside of the output, or the compositor may just store it if the toplevel surface is in maximiezd state, and may use it upon unmaximized.

event.name: configure
event.description: A configuration change that also includes the window origin in screen coordinates.

enum.name: state

description.summary: supplemental aura states to xdg states

enum.description: The states that are contained here are supplemental to the states defined in the XDG shell and specific aura windows.

entry.name: immersive

description.summary: immersive mode with hidden title bar and shelf

entry.description: User can access system UIs such as the shelf and window frame by pointing to, or swiping over, the screen edge.

entry.name: snapped_primary

description.summary: window is snapped in primary position

entry.description: The window is snapped to the left if the display is in landscape mode and at the top in portrait mode.

entry.name: snapped_secondary

description.summary: window is snapped in secondary position

entry.description: The window is snapped to the right if the display is in landscape mode and at the bottom in portrait mode.

entry.name: floated
entry.description: The window is floated on top of other windows. One floated window is allowed per desk. Floating a window when there is already a floated window on the same desk will unfloat the floated window.

entry.name: pip
entry.description: The window is in PiP mode.

event.name: origin_change
event.description: A notification sent when the window origin has changed. Unlike a configure, this does not imply the client needs to resize. The values are in screen coordinates.

request.name: set_restore_info

description.summary: set session id and restore id

request.description: Request session id and restore id of a newly created browser window. Set the information used by compositor to restore the toplevel surface state, such as window position, window state, upon creation. This is not double buffered and must be set before sending first commit.

request.name: set_system_modal
request.description: Requests that the toplevel surface should become a system modal. The compositor will prevent other windows from receiving events. If there are multiple system modal surfaces, the compositor will decide which one to receive events.

request.name: unset_system_modal
request.description: Requests that the system modal state of the toplevel surface will be unset. The compositor will then allow other windows to recieve events.

request.name: set_restore_info_with_window_id_source

description.summary: set session id and restore window id source

request.description: Request session id and restore id of the window. Set the information used by compositor to restore the toplevel surface state, such as window position, window state, upon creation. This is not double buffered and must be set before sending first commit. This is different from set_restore_info, used for clients that create multiple windows associated with restore_id_source.

request.name: set_decoration
request.description: Clients are allowed to request a particular decoration for a zaura_toplevel. The server is not required to honor this request. See decoration_type for available options. This must be set before the initial commit first, otherwise the subsequent request may not be fulfilled. Available since M105.

enum.name: decoration_type
enum.description: Decoration types are used to modify the surface (e.g. drop shadow).

request.name: release
request.description:
Destroy this zaura_toplevel object. A client should call destroy when the role is unmapped from a wl_surface.
See zaura_shell.release for destructor naming.

request.name: set_float
request.description: [Deprecated] Use set_float_to_location. This is a request to place the surface above others.

request.name: unset_float
request.description: Request that the surface resets floating.

request.name: set_z_order
request.description: Sets the z order for a toplevel surface. See z_order_level for available options.

arg.name: z_order
arg.summary: z order value for the window

enum.name: z_order_level
enum.description: Different z order levels that are used to set the z order for a toplevel surface.

entry.name: floating_window
entry.summary: a floating window z-ordered above other normal windows

entry.name: floating_ui_element
entry.summary: used to show non-window style UIs that are shown above floating windows

entry.name: security_surface
entry.summary: cannot be interfered with or covered up

request.name: set_origin
request.description:
Request a new location for the surface in device-independent pixels (DPs), relative to the top-left corner of the given output.
A null output means whichever output currently contains the surface.
These parameters are just a request and the compositor may ignore them, adjust them due to rules imposed by the window manager, or preserve them for future operations. For example, the compositor will not allow a position outside of the output; or the compositor may just store it if the toplevel surface is in maximized state, and may use it upon unmaximize.

request.name: activate
request.description: Activates this window. This is equivalent to bringing the window to the foreground. The compositor is free to ignore this request if it deems the client to be misbehaving.

request.name: deactivate
request.description: Deactivates this window. This is equivalent to requesting that the window not be the foreground window. The exact behavior is compositor-defined. The compositor is free to ignore this request if it deems the client to be misbehaving.

enum.name: fullscreen_mode

description.summary: Specifies the behavior of the surface in fullscreen.

enum.description: Possible windowing system behaviors if this surface were to go fullscreen.

entry.name: plain
entry.summary: user cannot access system UIs using mouse/touches

entry.name: immersive
entry.summary: user can access system UIs such as the shelf and window frame by pointing to, or swiping over, the screen edge

request.name: set_fullscreen_mode

description.summary: Sets the behavior of the surface in fullscreen.

request.description:
Suggests how the windowing manager should behave if this surface were to go fullscreen. Does not make the surface fullscreen.
In precise, if the surface is not in fullscreen yet, switching the mode does not have immediate impact from the client side perspective, but will change the behavior when making the surface fullscreen is requested next time. If the surface is already in fullscreen, then this request has an immediate impact to switch the fullscreen mode between plan and immersive.

request.name: set_scale_factor

description.summary: Allows the client to set the scale factor for the future buffer commits.

request.description: The client has a 32-bit float scale factor that is associated with each zaura toplevel. This scale factor must be propagated exactly to exo. To do so we reinterpret_cast into a 32-bit uint and later cast back into a float. This is because wayland does not support native transport of floats. As different CPU architectures may use different endian representations for IEEE 754 floats, this protocol implicitly assumes that the caller and receiver are the same machine. To avoid redundant messages, this request needs to only be called once when the zaura toplevel scale factor changes. This is double buffered state and will be applied in the next commit.

interface.request: Request that surface is snapped to the left or top if primary layout, right or bottom otherwise. />

request.name: set_snap_secondary

description.summary: snap the surface to the secondary snap position.

request.description: Request that surface is snapped to the right or bottom if primary layout, left or top otherwise.

entry.name: primary
entry.summary: snap the window to the left or top in primary layout, right or bottom in secondary layout

entry.name: secondary
entry.summary: snap the window to the right or bottom in primary layout, top or left in secondary layout

request.name: intent_to_snap

description.summary: client intents to snap the surface.

request.description: Notify (or inform) the server the client's intent to snap the window. To inform it's no longer willing to snap, send 'none'.

request.name: unset_snap
request.description: Request that window unsets snapping.

event.name: configure_raster_scale

description.summary: set the raster scale during a configure

event.description: Sets the raster scale of this window. This should be called during a configure event sequence. To do so we reinterpret_cast into a 32-bit uint and later cast back into a float. This is because wayland does not support native transport of floats. As different CPU architectures may use different endian representations for IEEE 754 floats, this protocol implicitly assumes that the caller and receiver are the same machine.

enum.name: persistable

description.summary: Describes whether or not the value is persistable

enum.description: Binary enum maps to boolean, describes whether or not a value is persistable.

request.name: set_persistable

description.summary: Describes if the window is persistable

request.description: Request the persistable status of a window. Sets the persistable status of the window in its window properties. Should be called before first commit.

request.name: set_shape

description.summary: set the shape of the surface in DP

request.description:
Sets the shape of the toplevel window in DP. Passing NULL will reset the shape of the window.
This should be used only in support of the existing (deprecated) Chrome Apps SetShape API and not for any other purpose.

request.name: set_top_inset

description.summary: set top inset to the surface

request.description: Sets the top inset to the surface. This represents the header height and should be non negative.

arg.name: height
arg.summary: Top inset of client window. Should be non negative.

event.name: rotate_focus
event.description:
Rotates focus within the toplevel window. The window must sort its focusable view into a stable and linearly traversable order. Prior to rotating focus, the surface should already be activated and have keyboard focus. If the surface has not been activated or does not have keyboard focus, the server should first activate and enter keyboard focus for the window. An example of event order could be:
1. activate surface 2. enter keyboard focus 3. rotate focus
If the window is not activated or does not have keyboard focus, the client should respond with a "not handled" and not perform any operation.
To start a new series rotation, the server will set the "restart" arg to true. If the "restart" arg is set to true, the window should set the focus on the first UI element for the given direction and not perform any rotation.
The client should respond with whether the rotation was successful via the "handled" field in the "ack_rotate_focus" request. The client should pass on the event serial and direction within the ack message.

arg.name: restart
arg.summary: whether or not to restart traversal

request.name: ack_rotate_focus
request.description:
If the focus has been successfully rotated between UI elements inside surface, client replies with 'handled'. If the focus didn't rotate, the client reply with 'not_handled'. A server may use this to move the focus to next focusable surface.
Note that a delay in processing in the client could result in stale acks received by the server.

arg.name: serial
arg.summary: serial for the original; rotation event

arg.name: handled
arg.summary: whether or not the rotation was successful

request.name: set_can_maximize

description.summary: Hint that the toplevel surface can be maximized

request.description: Hints to the window manager that the toplevel surface can be maximized.

request.name: unset_can_maximize

description.summary: Hint that the toplevel surface should not be maximized

request.description: Hints to the window manager that the toplevel surface should not be maximized. Note that the window manager might still request the client to be maximized. In such an event, the client should respect the window manager's request and maximize. It may unset the maximized state afterwards.

request.name: set_can_fullscreen

description.summary: Hint that the toplevel surface can enter fullscreen

request.description: Hints to the window manager that the toplevel surface can enter fullscreen.

request.name: unset_can_fullscreen

description.summary: Hint that the toplevel surface should not enter fullscreen

request.description: Hints to the window manager that the toplevel surface should not be enter fullscreen. Note that the window manager might still request the client enter fullscreen. In such an event, the client should respect the window manager's request and enter fullscreen. It may exit fullscreen afterwards.

enum.name: float_start_location

description.summary: Specifies the location of a surface that just got floated.

enum.description: Possible start locations if a surface gets floated.

entry.name: bottom_right
entry.summary: On float, surface goes to the bottom right of the work area. This is the default.

entry.name: bottom_left
entry.summary: On float, surface goes to the bottom left of the work area.

request.name: set_float_to_location
request.description: This is a request to place the surface above others.

request.name: set_window_corner_radii

description.summary: Request to apply rounded corners to the window of the surface.

request.description:
The client specifies the radius of each corner to be applied to the window in DPs (device independent pixels).
The window radius is double buffered, and will be applied at the time wl_surface.commit of the corresponding wl_surface is called.
Note: Rounded corner radii affects the wl_surface tree, including subsurfaces. Once this protocol is called, surfaces cannot set their own rounded corner bounds because rounded window bounds will be applied to the whole surface tree.

enum.name: in_overview

description.summary: Describes whether or not the value is in overview

enum.description: Binary enum maps to boolean, describes whether or not a value is in overview.

entry.name: not_in_overview
entry.summary: the value is not in overview

event.name: overview_change
event.description: The window is being shown in overview mode. Note that this is different than shell overview state, as not all windows will be part of the overview grid.

request.name: set_shadow_corner_radii

description.summary: Request to apply rounded corners to the shadow of the surface.

request.description:
The client specifies the radius of each corner to be applied to the shadow associated with the aura toplevel surface in device independent pixels (DPs).
The shadow radius is double buffered, and will be applied at the time wl_surface.commit of the corresponding wl_surface is called.

event.name: configure_occlusion_state

description.summary: set the occlusion state during a configure

event.description: Sets the occlusion state of this window. This should be called during a configure event sequence. This is used when the occlusion state needs to be set as a synchronized operation, compared to occlusion_state_changed, which is not synchronized. For example, this can be used to mark a window as hidden so it can discard resources. When making it visible again, it may need some time to recreate its buffers, which is why this operation needs to be synchronized.

interface.name: zaura_popup

description.summary: aura shell interface to the popup shell

interface.description: An interface to the popup shell, which allows the client to access shell specific functionality.

request.name: surface_submission_in_pixel_coordinates

description.summary: surface will be submitted in pixel coordinates

request.description: Informs the server that when submitting this surface, this client will not use wl_surface_set_buffer_scale to report the scales, nor will it apply scale via vp_viewporter. Instead the server should apply an appropriate scale transform for the submitted buffers to be composited correctly.

request.name: set_decoration
request.description: Clients are allowed to request a particular decoration for a zaura_toplevel. The server is not required to honor this request. See decoration_type for available options. Available since M105.

enum.name: decoration_type
enum.description: Decoration types are used to modify the surface (e.g. drop shadow).

request.name: set_menu
request.description: Set popup type to menu

request.name: release
request.description:
This request destroys the zaura_popup. A client should call destroy when the role is unmapped from a wl_surface.
See zaura_shell.release for destructor naming.

request.name: set_scale_factor

description.summary: Allows the client to set the scale factor for the future buffer commits.

request.description: The client has a 32-bit float scale factor that is associated with each zaura popup. This scale factor must be propagated exactly to exo. To do so we reinterpret_cast into a 32-bit uint and later cast back into a float. This is because wayland does not support native transport of floats. As different CPU architectures may use different endian representations for IEEE 754 floats, this protocol implicitly assumes that the caller and receiver are the same machine. To avoid redundant messages, this request needs to only be called once when the zaura popup's scale factor changes.

interface.name: zaura_output_manager

description.summary: aura shell interface to the output manager

interface.description:
[Deprecated] Deprecated since M122. See the zaura_output_manager_v2 interface.
A global responsible for ensuring clients have a complete view of a given output's state immediately following the bind of wl_output, and subsequently as needed.
Clients can expect that all the manager's events for a given wl_output arrive before the associated wl_output.done event. Clients must bind to the manager global before any output globals.

event.name: done
event.description: This event is sent after all relevant properties of a zaura_output_manager for a given wl_output have been sent.

event.name: display_id
event.description:
This event describes the 64bit display id assigned to each display by ChromeOS. The value is opaque and should not be interpreted.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

event.name: logical_position

description.summary: position of the output within the global compositor space

event.description:
The position event describes the location of the wl_output within the global compositor space.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

arg.name: x
arg.summary: x position within the global compositor space

arg.name: y
arg.summary: y position within the global compositor space

event.name: logical_size

description.summary: size of the output in the global compositor space

event.description:
The logical_size event describes the logical size of the output in the global compositor space.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

event.name: physical_size

description.summary: size of the output in pixels

event.description:
The physical resolution of the display in pixels. The value should not include any overscan insets or display rotation, except for any panel orientation adjustment.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

event.name: insets

description.summary: advertise the work area insets for the output

event.description:
This event describes the insets for the output in logical screen coordinates, from which the work area can be calculated.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

event.name: device_scale_factor

description.summary: advertise device scale factor for the output

event.description:
The scale factor of the output device. We reinterpret_cast the float scale factor into a 32-bit uint and later cast back into a float. This is because wayland does not support native transport of floats. As different CPU architectures may use different endian representations for IEEE 754 floats, this protocol implicitly assumes that the caller and receiver are the same machine.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

arg.name: device_scale_factor
arg.summary: display scale factor, in float format

event.name: logical_transform
event.description:
This event describes the logical transform for the output. Whereas panel transform corresponds to the display's panel rotation, the logical transform corresponds to the display's logical rotation.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

arg.name: transform
arg.summary: transform that maps framebuffer to output

event.name: panel_transform
event.description:
This event describes the panel transform for the output, which is the associated display's panel rotation.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

arg.name: transform
arg.summary: transform that maps framebuffer to output

event.name: name
event.description:
The name is a UTF-8 string with no convention defined for its contents.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

event.name: description
event.description:
The description is a UTF-8 string with no convention defined for its contents.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.

event.name: activated
event.description: Notifies that this output is now active output. It is typically used as a target when a new window is created without specific bounds.

event.name: overscan_insets

description.summary: advertise the overscan insets for the output

event.description:
This event describes the overscan insets for the output in physical pixels.
The event is sent when binding to the output object and subsequently as output state changes.
